alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 8:06AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Oklahoma, Lincoln, eastern Logan and southern Payne Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 806 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Meridian to near Luther to near Choctaw. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Oklahoma City, eastern Edmond, Cushing, Chandler, Choctaw, Harrah, Spencer, Perkins, Jones, Stroud, Nicoma Park, Langston, Luther, Meeker, Davenport, Wellston, Carney, Tryon, Ripley, and Agra. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 161 and 173. Interstate 44 between mile markers 141 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
